intro: Agelanthus henriquesii, commonly known as the Henriques' agelanthus, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall. Its flowering period usually occurs during the summer months, and it plays a minor role in local ecosystems by providing nectar to pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
